name: mesquite
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a small tree that grows in dry areas in the Americas and produces pods (= long, narrow, flat parts containing seeds) that can be used to make flour, or for feeding animals: Cottonwoods, mesquites, willows and tall grasses grew in abundance. Mesquite is really just a big weed, but years ago some savvy Texas ranchers fooled Californians into thinking it was a gourmet cooking wood.
[ U ] the wood of a mesquite tree, burned to add flavour to food: The meat owes its robust smoke flavour to mesquite. Marinated shrimp are grilled over mesquite hardwoods.
More examplesFewer examplesThe first thing you see when you pull off the highway is a mountain of mesquite logs. It's one of the few remaining large mesquite groves in the Tucson metro area.The river cuts through stands of mesquite and cottonwoods.
